name: Authorization and Supervision
description: Procedures to ensure workforce members are authorized and properly supervised in their access to ePHI
components: Authorization procedures, role-based access control, supervision methods, delegation authority, monitoring processes

name: Workforce Clearance Procedures
description: Assessment and verification process to determine workforce members' suitability for access to ePHI
components: Background checks, criminal history review, credit checks, reference verification, medical evaluation, clearance documentation

name: Termination Procedures
description: Formal processes to manage workforce member separation and ensure immediate access revocation
components: Notice requirements, final duties, access removal timeline, equipment return, documentation, confidentiality agreements

name: Workforce Security Policy
description: Comprehensive documented policy governing all aspects of workforce access and management
components: Policy documentation, scope definition, roles and responsibilities, approval authority, annual review procedures

name: Unique User Identification
description: System for assigning unique identifiers to all users accessing ePHI systems
components: User ID format, assignment procedures, uniqueness verification, deactivation procedures, documentation requirements

name: User Authentication
description: Mechanisms to verify user identity before granting access to ePHI systems
components: Password requirements, multi-factor authentication, biometric authentication, authentication failure procedures, audit logging

name: Access Control Standards
description: Policies and procedures to limit ePHI access to authorized users and functions
components: Access determination criteria, approval process, least privilege principle, emergency access procedures, access review cycles

name: Emergency Access Procedures
description: Documented procedures for providing access to ePHI during emergencies when normal access is unavailable
components: Emergency identification, justification requirements, temporary access duration, audit trail requirements, documentation procedures

name: Automatic Logoff
description: System implementation to terminate inactive user sessions automatically
components: Inactivity timeout period, session termination procedures, user notification, system re-authentication, exception handling

name: Encryption and Decryption
description: Processes for encrypting ePHI at rest and in transit to protect from unauthorized access
components: Encryption standards, key management, encryption algorithms, decryption procedures, implementation verification, testing

name: Workforce Training Program
description: Comprehensive training to ensure workforce understands HIPAA requirements and security procedures
components: Training curriculum, role-specific modules, frequency, documentation, competency assessment, refresher training schedule

name: Security Reminders
description: Regular communications to reinforce workforce awareness of security practices and policies
components: Reminder frequency, communication methods, topics covered, documentation, effectiveness measurement, targeted messaging

name: Protection from Malicious Software
description: Measures to protect systems from viruses malware and other malicious code
components: Antivirus software, malware detection, automatic updates, scanning procedures, quarantine processes, incident response

name: Log-in Monitoring
description: Procedures to monitor and review system login attempts and user activities
components: Login tracking, failed attempt monitoring, unusual activity detection, alert procedures, log retention, analysis methods

name: Password Management
description: Policies and procedures for creating maintaining and changing user passwords
components: Password complexity requirements, minimum length, expiration period, history restrictions, reset procedures, storage security

name: Workforce Access Audit
description: Regular review and audit of workforce members who have access to ePHI systems
components: Audit schedule, access verification, appropriateness assessment, documentation, corrective action procedures, evidence retention

name: Access Management Documentation
description: Comprehensive records of all workforce access decisions and changes
components: Access request forms, approval documentation, change logs, termination records, review documentation, retention requirements

name: Role-Based Access Control
description: System of defining and implementing access based on defined job roles and functions
components: Role definition, role inventory, role assignment procedures, role review cycles, role modification process, documentation

name: Segregation of Duties
description: Procedures to ensure no single individual can make unauthorized changes to ePHI systems
components: Duty separation requirements, approval workflows, system configuration, conflict detection, exception procedures, monitoring

name: Workforce Security Incident Response
description: Procedures for responding to security incidents involving workforce member access or actions
components: Incident reporting, investigation procedures, corrective actions, disciplinary measures, documentation, monitoring for recurrence
